file_content.text: Too weak... too weak! I am freed only to be delivered greater indignity!
I will suffer it. Take what you want of me but my life. That I cannot give until my purpose is complete.
What is your name, monster?
As a Shadow Killer, you are honor-bound to serve me, are you not?
What is honor to the dead?
Your purpose now is to devour my enemies. You will not go hungry.
This is acceptable. I will need my strength for what is to come.
Who are you?
You can start with an apology for trying to eat me.
What sort of creature seeks respect from the vanquished? As you will: I am sorry I could not kill you.
What do you have to offer me in exchange for your life?
Before the destruction of my homeworld, I was its most feared Shadow Killer.
I was Ak'ghal Usar. Last lord of Urkupp, the lost dominion of Cron, and subjugator of the Kon'me. All that remains is my vengeance.
When I am avenged, I will have no other purpose than to serve your whims. Not before.
Are you seeking retribution against those who imprisoned you here?
The one who delayed my awakening will suffer, but he is not who brought me to this world.
Your servitude isn't required, but I may take your help. Tell me what happened to you.
I don't have time to indulge your personal vendetta.
I have waited centuries for this moment. I will have it.
My home world was burned and shattered by the ambition of Exar Kun. Millions of Dashade turned to ash in the wake of an atrocity not even meant for us.
I followed him here. I came to consume his very being for what he had done. I was too late.
[Say nothing]
Kun was already dead?
So it seemed.
Such a pointless loss of life. I'm sorry.
I care nothing for pity.
The means to cause such a cataclysm, does it still exist?
Is whatever he used to cause that still out there?
The weapon and its wielder were annihilated by the Dark Lord's design.
I found this moon a smoldering ruin. Months, I scoured for a sign. My worst fears were confirmed by his Massassi worshipers.
The stragglers I found all spoke of the Dark Lord's ascendance into an immortal spirit. Beyond my reach and my wrath.
Why stay then?
I would not be denied so easily.
I'm surprised you got the Massassi to speak to you.
They had lost the only thing they could fear more than me.
You're saying he destroyed this place to become immortal? Sounds familiar.
He sacrificed countless Massassi, but it was the Jedi that burned this world to stop him.
Buried here among the secrets of the ancient Sith, I found the means to restore Exar Kun to life.
The life of this moon was meant to fuel the mechanism, and it had nothing left to give. Until today.
The Temple of Sacrifice was destroyed when someone else tried to use it.
I would never let you use the temple even if it were still possible to do so.
There is nothing here worth more than my retribution!
Explain yourself!
You've waited a long time for disappointment. That device is in ruin.
What? No! No!
Exar Kun's fetid soul is forever beyond my reach!
This is his fault! The black-eyed Sith! He turned this place into my prison instead of my salvation!
This black-eyed Sith, do you know who he was?
I do not know his name. Only his dead eyes and his power.
How do you know he's responsible?
He was the first to wake me, so long ago.
After all this insanity has cost you, you still need someone to blame.
Someone must suffer for it!
He took this place as his own and locked me away to protect his precious temple.
The Sith Emperor. I know your enemy. I've fought him for a long time now.
He's as dead as anyone strongly connected to the Force can be. His son has conquered much of the galaxy.
A son. A tyrant. He shall inherit the crimes of his ancestor. Of all Sith who have wronged me!
His body is dead, but he still lingers. You won't be able to exact your punishment against him directly, but I know how to hurt him.
To never taste the anguish of these men leaves me hollow. I crave anything to satiate my rage.
So long as you mean harm to my enemies, I shall serve you willingly.
Show me redemption, little Jedi.
Show me redemption, little Sith.
Show me redemption, little whelp.
Ahh, the seal is broken, and this tomb breathes once more. As do I.
How long since I tasted this air?
No, not as I remember. This place has the richness of life, not the acrid tang of devastation.
You are not the jailer who trapped me. Speak your purpose.
I have come to reclaim the treasures of the ancient Sith.
You are no Sith I have seen, but you reek of them.
Are you another servant of Tulak Hord? Or an enemy?
I do not answer your questions, creature. You answer mine.
I wanted to see what was contained here and if it could help me.
You did not stumble here. You were guided.
Jailer? You were kept prisoner here?
You think to play tricks on my mind in this weakened state. I am not fooled.
That's none of your business.
Hunger gnaws at my patience. You can appease it or my curiosity.
Tell me: are you a servant of Exar Kun or the black-eyed Sith?
Neither.
Do you know their fates?
What's your interest in them?
I have had my fill of your talk. My other cravings are of more interest.
Exar Kun died long ago, and I don't know any black-eyed Sith.
Then I have much to do, and I shall need my strength.
I don't, no.
Who are these people you're speaking of?
Ignorant empty vessel. At least I may find you filling.
My loyalty is to Exar Kun.
I serve the black-eyed Sith.
Then you shall whet my appetite for the feast to come.
I have not consumed power such as yours in longer than I can remember. I shall savor it.
You will make a meager repast, but ageless hunger will sweeten your demise.
[Attack] I've heard enough of your demands and threats. Time to learn your place.
Wretched morsel! Come and be devoured!
For all his claims of immortality, his interest in the temple betrays those lies. If it was destroyed, he may be dead, too.
You may join my Alliance. Keep your word, and you'll find things a lot more comfortable than here.
Well, you certainly came to accept the order of things more quickly than Khem Val.
Do not insult the legacy of such a Shadow Killer. Khem Val honored Tulak Hord's victory with unwavering loyalty. Few shared his renown.
My service to you will pale to it in every way, but the dead have no right to complain.
[Reject companion] I don't know that you're the kind of company I want to keep. Enjoy your freedom.
Enjoy? I can never have what I crave, but I will find something to sate the pangs. This I swear.
Do not cross me, and I will not cross you.
[Reject companion] Waking you was an accident and a mistake. You're too dangerous to leave this place.
I am denied so much, but I will not be denied your pain!
